entry.title: IYK Raises $16.8 Million to Power Token-Enabled Fashion With NFTs
entry.summary: After working with Adidas, 9dcc, and more, IYK has launched a self-serve platform for creating NFC-chipped products.

entry.title: What Are Crypto Futures, Coinbase's Latest Offering?
entry.summary: Futures contracts have a long and storied history—but for Bitcoin traders, they’ve unlocked new strategies.

entry.title: Coinbase Rolls Out Futures Trading for Retail Crypto Traders Globally
entry.summary: The crypto exchange has set its sights on global expansion amid ongoing legal challenges from the SEC in the U.S.

entry.title: Binance Chief Says Former Russia Unit CommEx 'Does Not Service US or EU Users'
entry.summary: As part of the recent sale, Binance CEO said that “a few ex-Binance CIS team members” may join the CommEx team.

entry.title: SEC Extends Deadline for Ark Invest, VanEck Spot Ethereum ETF Filings
entry.summary: Though VanEck and Ark Invest have been hit with delays, a futures-based ETF could see approval by next week.

entry.title: What Price for Your Money? Liberty, Security, and CBDCs
entry.summary: CBDCs promise to energise economic growth through greater efficiency and security—at the cost of enshrining fiat’s dominance.

entry.title: Binance Urges Euro Users to Convert to Tether After Bank Partnership Ends
entry.summary: Following Paysafe's unilateral split from Binance, users are advised to move their euro balances to Tether’s USDT.

entry.title: Only Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Chainlink Are Meaningfully Decentralized: Sergey Nazarov
entry.summary: Amid falling bridges and staking cartels, industry experts like the Chainlink co-founder are again debating the age-old question of decentralization.

entry.title: Crypto Platform Fireblocks Expands Institutional Access to Tezos
entry.summary: The expansion follows Tezos’ “Mumbai” upgrade earlier this year.

entry.title: The Law Must Evolve To Make CBDCs Possible, Says BIS Chief
entry.summary: “It is simply unacceptable that unclear or outdated legal frameworks could hinder [CBDC] deployment,” said BIS General Manager Agustín Carstens.

entry.title: Yes, the CIA Is Building an AI Chatbot
entry.summary: The I in AI is now making its way into U.S. intelligence agencies. The CIA announced it has begun creating its own AI chatbot much like the wildly popular ChatGPT. Nameless for now, the tool will be trained on publicly available data and aims to help U.S. spies to quickly verify information. Bloomberg reported that […]

entry.title: Meta Quest 3: Everything You Need to Know
entry.summary: Mixed reality at a fraction of the price of the Apple Vision Pro. Will it be worth it? Here’s the latest on the Meta Quest 3.

entry.title: Next-Gen Xbox: Everything You Need to Know From Microsoft Leaks
entry.summary: UPDATE: Microsoft's documents suggest an Xbox crypto wallet. Here's what we know so far about the next-gen Xbox hardware.

entry.title: Social Media Sentiment Is Key to Crypto Price Discovery
entry.summary: Sacha Ghebali, Director of Strategy and Business Development at The TIE, says social media sentiment remains a key factor in price movements for major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. However, he notes that sentiment has turned more negative lately amid regulatory uncertainty. Ghebali believes events like the Ripple lawsuit ruling significantly impacted sentiment and prices. André Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet.

entry.title: SAG-AFTRA Strike Continues Amid Ongoing Concerns Over AI in Hollywood
entry.summary: SAG-AFTRA's fight for proper compensation continues as the WGA strike concludes.

entry.title: Is a Tokenized Pokémon Card a Security? SEC Chair Gary Gensler Responds—Kinda
entry.summary: U.S. Representative Ritchie Torres questioned Gensler, using Pokémon cards as an example—and told Decrypt the SEC Chair's responses were "incoherent."

entry.title: Nintendo Switch 2: Everything You Need to Know
entry.summary: UPDATE: Leakers say that a pair of massive games are headed to the Switch 2. Here's the latest on the next Nintendo console.

entry.title: Marathon Mined an Invalid Bitcoin Block—Here's What That Means
entry.summary: Marathon (MARA) shares have dipped 2.9% since the accident occurred.

entry.title: Meta Unveils Glasses, Chatbots, Image Editing Powered by AI
entry.summary: “AI is shaping the way we build the metaverse,” said Chief Technology Officer Andrew Bosworth.

entry.title: OpenAI's ChatGPT Now Searches the Web in Real Time—Again
entry.summary: The ability to search for current information was taken offline earlier this year when it was being used to bypass paywalls.

entry.title: Longevity Starts With Ending ‘Self-Destructive Behavior', Says Anti-Aging Obsessed Billionaire
entry.summary: In an interview with Bloomberg, Kernel founder Bryan Johnson says simple changes can extend our lives.

author.name: Decrypt AI, Edited by Ryan Ozawa

entry.title: Xbox Goes Crypto? Leaked Microsoft Roadmap Includes Wallet Plans
entry.summary: Documents published by Microsoft in the FTC case reveal plans for an Xbox crypto wallet. Will it still happen? Here's what we know.

entry.title: You Can Now Trade Bitcoin Mining Hashpower on Arbitrum
entry.summary: The Lumerin Hashpower Marketplace creates a novel method for decentralizing Bitcoin's global hashrate and makes mining accessible to retail investors.

entry.title: Pro-Crypto Lawmakers Blast Gensler for 'Loyalty' to Big Banks
entry.summary: At a Wednesday hearing, Congressman Tom Emmer told the SEC chair that he is not an impartial regulator for crypto.

entry.title: Former NBA Champion Matthew Dellavedova Joins Swan Bitcoin
entry.summary: The basketball player used to reach out to Bitcoiners to offer them tickets to his NBA games. “Some people thought I was scamming them,” he told Decrypt.

entry.title: How the Three Arrows Collapse Changed Ethereum DeFi Lending
entry.summary: Maple Finance’s Sidney Powell said that managing counterparty risk is now key in the industry.

entry.title: Cloudflare Launches AI Platform to Support Scalable AI Applications
entry.summary: The tech giant says its new platform, Cloudflare AI, allows developers to build scalable AI applications quickly and affordably.

entry.title: DeFi Tokens Buck Bearish Market Trend as Bond Yields Soar
entry.summary: With Treasury notes hitting levels not seen since 2007, DeFi protocols tapping the real-world asset trend are on the rise.

entry.title: Chainlink Extends Cross-Chain Protocol to Coinbase’s Base
entry.summary: The oracle platform has integrated its CCIP communication protocol with Base to enable the development of cross-chain dapps and services.

entry.title: Hollywood Writers End Strike Following Successful Agreement Negotiations
entry.summary: The new agreement includes clear guidelines regarding the use of artificial intelligence in the film and TV industry.

entry.title: Binance Quits Russia With Sale of Local Business to CommEX
entry.summary: The exchange is leaving the Russian market over compliance concerns, selling its regional unit to the newly-launched CommEX.

entry.title: Bankrupt Crypto Firm BlockFi Gets Court Approval for Restructure Plan
entry.summary: This decision marks a significant step in the platform's ongoing bankruptcy proceedings, offering clarity to stranded investors.

entry.title: The Man Who Bought 100 CryptoPunks—Before They Were Famous
entry.summary: French NFT collector Dan Polko bet big on CryptoPunks before the crowd. Now he’s taking inspiration from 19th-century art collectors.

entry.title: SEC Again Delays Decision on Ark’s Bitcoin ETF Filing
entry.summary: The SEC made the call this week, even though it wasn't required to issue a decision until November 11.

entry.title: Beyond ChatGPT: NExT-GPT is an OpenSource Model That Lets You Master AI With Audio, Video and Text
entry.summary: The new ‘any-to-any’ AI could leapfrog largely text-only giants and compete with visual tools like Google’s Gemini and OpenAI’s ChatGPT-Vision.

entry.title: Texas Is Now the Top US Bitcoin Mining Spot: Foundry
entry.summary: A digital asset researcher at Cambridge says the region's dominance "does not come as a surprise."

entry.title: Judge Rules Sam Bankman-Fried Can’t Mention Effective Altruism or Jail Time in Court
entry.summary: References to witnesses’ recreational drug use, however, got the green light.

entry.title: 500Altcoins discusses DeFi Summer and the Dubai Crypto Scene - This Time Will Be Different - Episode 2
entry.summary: Our host Reza Jafery is joined by Gareth Fenney aka 500Altcoins. They discuss the glory days of DeFi Summer and whether or not its a smart move for builders in the crypto space to relocate to Dubai.

entry.title: Decentralize Derivatives Trading with Custom Blockchain
entry.summary: David Gogel of dYdX discusses how the decentralized exchange is building a custom blockchain to fully decentralize derivatives trading. He explained how the new dYdX chain will allow validators to run order books in memory, enabling decentralized order matching at scale. This shift aims to increase security and transparency for traders while maintaining the performance of centralized exchanges.

entry.title: Newly Partnered with Visa, Solana Focuses on Reliability
entry.summary: Solana has improved network reliability through upgrades like Quick and local fee markets. It recently partnered with Visa to allow settling transactions in USDC on Solana. This could enable merchants to receive instant payments and save on credit card processing fees. Stacy Elliott spoke with Austin Federa, Head of Strategy for the Solana Foundation, at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: India's 1% Crypto Tax Has Been a Nightmare for High-Frequency Traders, Says Shardeum CEO
entry.summary: As India figures out its regulatory approach to the crypto industry, one thing is clear to Shardeum co-founder Nischal Shetty: “If you're a high-frequency trader, you can't afford to lose a percentage every time you sell,” he told Decrypt's Andre Beganski at Messari Mainnet in New York. “That's something that's caused a lot of issues.”

entry.title: Most Crypto Users Don't Trust Themselves to Keep Their Seed Phrase Safe: Ledger CEO
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Ledger CEO Pascal Gauthier to discuss crypto custody post-FTX, and the hardware wallet manufacturer's controversial Ledger Recover service.

entry.title: Crypto Accounting Challenges and Opportunities
entry.summary: As crypto matures, accounting and tax regulations are evolving. Amy Kalnoki of Bitwave explains how her company helps crypto companies properly account for digital assets. She notes the importance of flexibility as new crypto assets emerge and regulations change. Stacy Elliott interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Base as a 'Bridge, Not an Island'
entry.summary: Coinbase's Jesse Pollak, creator of layer-2 blockchain Base, says the launch of the network has exceeded expectations, even if plans changed along the way. He believes Arbitrum One will help bring billions onto blockchain by enabling seamless user experiences. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Explosive Growth Ahead for Enterprise Blockchain
entry.summary: Paul Brody drives Ernst & Young (EY) initiatives and investments in blockchain technology across consulting, audit, and tax business lines. He says enterprise blockchain adoption is nearing an inflection point. Brody believes blockchains will one day handle 40 billion transactions daily across industries like automotive and pharma. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Bitcoin's Narrative Is Shifting Towards Layer-2 Solutions
entry.summary: Rich Rhines, original Core DAO contributor and former Coinbase engineer, discusses how the narrative around Bitcoin is shifting in 2023. While Bitcoin remains digital gold, new layer 2 solutionsare emerging to unlock more utility and value from the huge amounts of capital stored in Bitcoin. He says these innovations can benefit Bitcoin holders while keeping Bitcoin maximalists happy by building outside the base layer. André Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Building a Developer-Friendly zkRollup to Scale Ethereum
entry.summary: Daniel Helm, head of Developer Relations at Scroll, discussess how they are building a zkRollup to scale Ethereum transactions and lower fees. He explained their focus on creating a seamless developer experience by maintaining Ethereum's ethos and tooling. Scroll aims to launch their mainnet soon, providing more scalable blockspace for Ethereum developers. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Regulation Threatens U.S. Dominance of Financial Markets, Says CoinRoutes CEO
entry.summary: Dave Weisberger, Co-Founder and CEO of CoinRoutes, argued that excessive regulation in the U.S. threatens to undermine the country's long-standing dominance in global financial markets. He warned that other countries are embracing blockchain and crypto to build more efficient digital markets, which could cause the US to lose its competitive edge and trillions in GDP. Weisberger said CoinRoutes is now focusing more on expanding internationally due to restrictive policies in the U.S. He was interviewed by André Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: We Need to Start Thinking About How we Make Crypto Easy to Use: Robinhood Crypto General Manager
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Robinhood Crypto general manager Johann Kerbrat at Messari Mainnet 2023, to talk about the trading platform's crypto wallet, onboarding new users through simplicity, and keeping platform fees sustainable.

entry.title: On-Chain Gaming Poised for Mass Adoption
entry.summary: Jack O'Holleran is CEO and co-founder of SKALE Labs. He explains how on-chain gaming is ready for the mainstream after overcoming early challenges like high fees and poor user experience. Companies can now build blockchain games that look and feel like traditional games, and scalability improvements allow games to support hundreds of millions of players without performance issues. He was interviewed by André Beganski at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: New Blockchains Boom Creates Opportunity and Challenges
entry.summary: Billy Sebell of the XDC Foundation discussed the proliferation of new layer-1 and layer-2 blockchain solutions. While this expands possibilities, he noted projects must still attract users amidst growing competition. Sebell highlighted the benefits of targeting niche use cases and bringing real-world assets on-chain via tokenization. He was interviewed by André Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Accessible Self-Custody for Crypto
entry.summary: Dave Lemke is the CFO & CCO at Giddy, creators of a crypto wallet with decentralized private key security. He explains how their solution allows self-custody while still being recoverable. He highlighted increasing demand for self-custody after the FTX collapse. Lemke also touched on upcoming US crypto regulations and Getty's roadmap to simplify staking and other complex processes. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Defi Education Fund Advocates for Responsible Crypto Regulation
entry.summary: Amanda Tuminelli of the Defi Education Fund discusses the need for sensible crypto regulation. She says regulators should work with the industry to understand how protocols work before proposing expansive rules that could stifle innovation. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Train Your Own AI-Powered Fighter? Inside AI Arena
entry.summary: What is AI Arena? Decrypt's Kate Irwin dives into the upcoming video game in an interview with the game's founders, AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie.

entry.title: DeFi Lenders and Borrowers Are More Cautious Than Ever. Maple Finance's Sidney Powell Explains Why
entry.summary: Sidney Powell, co-founder of DeFi lender Maple Finance, sits down with Decrypt reporter André Beganski to talk risk management in DeFi and how the crypto lending and borrowing landscape has changed within the last year.

entry.title: Most DeFi Hacks Are Due to ‘Dumb Mistakes,’ Not On-Chain Vulnerabilities: Halborn
entry.summary: “I think as the ecosystem starts to mature, we'll start to see a slowdown of some of the dumb mistakes that a lot of projects are making,” Halborn COO David Schwed told Decrypt at Messari Mainnet. “This is a controversial statement, but many hacks are preventable.”
